subject: Simsonn Pro X Pedals stuck in upgrade mode after firmware update failed
description_text:
Hello Simsonn Team,

my Pro X Pedals are stuck in “upgrade mode” after the firmware update
failed.
The Simsonn Manager only shows “The main controller is in upgrade mode” and
does not offer any firmware update anymore.

Could you please send me the correct firmware file for manual flashing or
provide a recovery tool?

Thank you!
Best regards,
Peter

conversations.body_text: Hello, Peter Potrawa,     Please uninstall the old version on your computer, then reinstall version 2.1.2 and update the firmware.  After the update, the device version should display as CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.3.  If the issue persists, please feel free to contact me.  Also, make sure the upgrade button on the control box has popped up, then reconnect the USB cable.   https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PZwHUqhhmJw0IBGDO8mGONPbrICJU3z1/view?usp=drive_link

Hello,
I have uninstalled the Simsonn Manager and installed the version from your
download link,
but I still don’t get any firmware update option.

On the update page there is a manual update function —
could you please just send me the firmware update file (.bin or .hex)
directly,
so that I can flash it manually?

My controller is stuck in *Upgrade Mode* after the previous update failed.

Thank you very much for your help!

*Sorry,*
I just noticed that there was a *Firmware* folder, and I tried the manual
update —
everything is working again now!

Thank you very much for your help! ?
